snippet: James R. Clapper Jr., the director of national intelligence, said the technology was not yet fully in place to prevent another insider from stealing top-secret data, as Edward J. Snowden did.
abstract: National Intelligence Dir James R Clapper acknowledges in testimony before Armed Services Committee that technology is not yet in place to prevent another insider from stealing top-secret data, as Edward J Snowden did.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and ERIC SCHMITT

lead_paragraph: James R. Clapper Jr., the director of national intelligence, said the technology was not yet fully in place to prevent another insider from stealing top-secret data, as Edward J. Snowden did.

headline.main: Spy Chief Says Snowden Took Advantage of ‘Perfect Storm’ of Security Lapses
headline.print_headline: Data Security and Snowden in Testimony of Spy Chief
